p: Approximately 1 g of the dried OV ADAR was pulverized and then extracted with 300 mL of ethanol 80% v/v in the dark in an ultrasonic bath for 30 min, keeping the temperature under control (less than 30 °C) and finally centrifuged. The supernatant was immediately concentrated under vacuum, and a brown extract was obtained (191 mg). For the HPLC analysis, 5 mg of the oregano extract was dissolved in 2 mL of methanol HPLC grade, filtered (PTFE filter), and 10 µL were injected in the instrument. For the TPC, TFC, antioxidant and enzymatic analyses 1 mg/mL of stock solution were used. For the antibacterial assay was used, a 20 mg/mL stock solution was prepared in ethanol.
